sentences.text: No candidate received a majority of votes in the first round, with right-wing challenger Gordana Siljanovska-Davkova placing first by a wide margin with 41% of the vote, while Pendarovski finished second with 20% of the vote. The two faced off in the second round run-off on 8 May, which was held alongside 2024 North Macedonian parliamentary election|parliamentary elections. In the second round, Siljanovska defeated the incumbent Pendarovski with 69% of the vote and became the first woman to be elected president of North Macedonia. She was inaugurated on 12 May.

references.text: <ref>{{cite news |title=Right-wing challenger wins first round in North Macedonia presidential election |url=https://www.france24.com/en/europe/20240425-n-macedonia-s-right-wing-candidate-wins-first-round-presidential-election |work=France 24 |date=25 April 2024 |access-date=25 April 2024 |archive-date=25 April 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240425055545/https://www.france24.com/en/europe/20240425-n-macedonia-s-right-wing-candidate-wins-first-round-presidential-election |url-status=live }}</ref>

<ref name="apwoman">{{Cite web |date=9 May 2024 |title=North Macedonia elects first woman president as center-left incumbents suffer historic losses |url=https://apnews.com/article/north-macedonia-election-corruption-european-union-bulgaria-ac12182171ed7d46f160feeb469c7aa4 |access-date=9 May 2024 |website=Associated Press |language=en |archive-date=9 May 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240509011558/https://apnews.com/article/north-macedonia-election-corruption-european-union-bulgaria-ac12182171ed7d46f160feeb469c7aa4 |url-status=live }}</ref>

sentences.text: The President of North Macedonia is elected using a modified two-round system; a candidate can only be elected in the first round of voting if they receive the equivalent of over 50% of the vote from all registered voters. In the second round, voter turnout must be at least 40% for the result to be deemed valid. Before 2009, the constitution required turnout in the second round to be 50% to validate the result. However, the XXXI amendment approved on 9 January 2009 lowered the threshold to 40%,

references.text: <ref>[http://www.balkaninsight.com/en/article/polls-open-in-macedonia-presidential-elections-2 Polls Open in Macedonia Presidential Elections] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140415205029/http://www.balkaninsight.com/en/article/polls-open-in-macedonia-presidential-elections-2 |date=15 April 2014 }} Balkan Insight, 13 April 2014</ref>

<ref name=XXXI>[https://www.sobranie.mk/the-constitution-of-the-republic-of-macedonia.nspx Amendment XXXI] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200319062234/https://www.sobranie.mk/the-constitution-of-the-republic-of-macedonia.nspx |date=19 March 2020 }} Constitution of North Macedonia</ref>

<ref name=XXXI/> as the then-government feared the trend of reducing turnouts would lead to presidential elections being frequently invalidated. In the 2009 Macedonian presidential election|2009 presidential elections, second round turnout was just 42.6%.<ref>Anna Fruhstorfer & Michael Hein (2016) [https://books.google.com/books?id=tRhADQAAQBAJ&pg=PA325 ''Constitutional Politics in Central and Eastern Europe: From Post-Socialist Transition to the Reform of Political Systems''] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240427185033/https://books.google.com/books?id=tRhADQAAQBAJ&pg=PA325#v=onepage&q&f=false |date=27 April 2024 }} Springer, p235</ref>

sentences.text: In order to contest the election, potential candidates are required to collect signatures from at least 10,000 registered voters or 30 MPs.

sentences.text: Stevo Pendarovski supported revising the Constitution of North Macedonia|constitution to include recognition of a Bulgarians in North Macedonia|Bulgarian minority in North Macedonia, a condition set by Bulgaria to allow the country's Accession of North Macedonia to the European Union|accession to the European Union. Gordana Siljanovska-Davkova called for negotiations with the EU under a new framework and for such amendments to be made after North Macedonia attains EU membership. Pendarovski called on fighting corruption through taking on organized criminal groups, while Siljanovska-Davkova focused on the judiciary in her anti-corruption stance.

references.text: <ref>{{cite web |title=North Macedonia to elect president after campaign focused on hot-button issue of EU membership |url=https://apnews.com/article/north-macedonia-election-president-european-union-185e7e3870c4017114e6d148df0320ba |website=Associated Press |language=en |date=23 April 2024 |access-date=23 April 2024 |archive-date=23 April 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240423060112/https://apnews.com/article/north-macedonia-election-president-european-union-185e7e3870c4017114e6d148df0320ba |url-status=live }}</ref>

<ref>{{cite web |title=North Macedonia votes in presidential polls as EU membership bid looms |url=https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2024/4/24/north-macedonia-votes-for-president-as-eu-membership-bid-looms |website=Al Jazeera |language=en |date=24 April 2024 |access-date=24 April 2024 |archive-date=24 April 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240424135608/https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2024/4/24/north-macedonia-votes-for-president-as-eu-membership-bid-looms |url-status=live }}</ref>

sentences.text: Following the first round, Gordana Siljanovska-Davkova said "the hour has come for this government to go" and described the results as a "new course". She also called on voters to prove "that we have always (belonged to) Europe". Stevo Pendarovski expressed surprise and disappointment with the result, but expressed hope for improvement in the second round, including with the support of the Albanians in North Macedonia|Albanian community.<ref name="f24"/>

references.text: <ref>{{cite web |title=EU membership on the table as North Macedonia holds first round of presidential vote |url=https://www.france24.com/en/europe/20240424-eu-membership-on-the-table-as-north-macedonia-holds-first-round-of-presidential-vote |website=France 24 |language=en |date=24 April 2024 |access-date=25 April 2024 |archive-date=25 April 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240425061625/https://www.france24.com/en/europe/20240424-eu-membership-on-the-table-as-north-macedonia-holds-first-round-of-presidential-vote |url-status=live }}</ref>

<ref>{{cite web |title=EU hopeful North Macedonia to hold May 8 presidential runoff with center-right candidate in the lead |url=https://apnews.com/article/north-macedonia-presidential-elections-d7c0cc09c0712de5175a6d34eacb8d83 |website=Associated Press |language=en |date=25 April 2024 |access-date=24 April 2024 |archive-date=24 April 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240424050655/https://apnews.com/article/north-macedonia-presidential-elections-d7c0cc09c0712de5175a6d34eacb8d83 |url-status=live }}</ref>

sentences.text: Polling in the first round opened at 07:00 on 24 April and lasted until 19:00 at 3,480 polling stations nationwide. About 1.8 million people were eligible to vote, while around 2,300 domestic and international observers monitored the proceedings.<ref name="apwoman"/>

references.text: <ref>{{cite web |title=Longtime EU hopeful North Macedonia holds presidential polls centered on bloc accession, rule of law |url=https://apnews.com/article/north-macedonia-presidential-elections-d7c0cc09c0712de5175a6d34eacb8d83 |website=Associated Press |language=en |date=24 April 2024 |access-date=24 April 2024 |archive-date=24 April 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240424050655/https://apnews.com/article/north-macedonia-presidential-elections-d7c0cc09c0712de5175a6d34eacb8d83 |url-status=live }}</ref>

<ref name="f24">{{cite web |title=N. Macedonia's right-wing candidate wins first round presidential election |url=https://www.france24.com/en/europe/20240425-n-macedonia-s-right-wing-candidate-wins-first-round-presidential-election |website=France 24 |language=en |date=25 April 2024 |access-date=25 April 2024 |archive-date=25 April 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240425055545/https://www.france24.com/en/europe/20240425-n-macedonia-s-right-wing-candidate-wins-first-round-presidential-election |url-status=live }}</ref>

sentences.text: According to international observers, the elections were "competitive and an extensive and pluralistic campaign helped voters to make an informed choice, but marred by negative rhetoric with nationalistic slogans, as well as shortcomings in the legislation and insufficient oversight of campaign finances".

references.text: <ref>{{cite web |title=North Macedonia's elections were competitive and voters well informed, although the process remains insufficiently regulated: international observers |url=https://www.osce.org/odihr/elections/north-macedonia/568306 |website=OSCE |access-date=10 May 2024 |date=9 May 2024 |archive-date=9 May 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240509231155/https://www.osce.org/odihr/elections/north-macedonia/568306 |url-status=live }}</ref>

sentences.text:
*{{flag|Croatia}} — Prime Minister Andrej Plenković congratulated Siljanovska-Davkova on her victory.
*{{flag|European Union}} — Ambassador David Geer congratulated Gordana Siljanovska-Davkova for her election, noting that he is "looking forward to working closely with her for the European future of the country." In addition, Oliver Varhelyi, the European Commissioner for Neighbourhood and Enlargement, congratulated Siljanovska-Davkova and highlighted the need "to speed up the necessary reforms to move forward in the EU accession negotiation process."
*{{flag|Hungary}} — Prime Minister Viktor Orbán congratulated Siljanovska-Davkova and her VMRO-DPMNE on their "well-deserved and historic victory" in the presidential and parliamentary elections. Orban added that he looked forward to working together on giving North Macedonia a "new momentum to the EU accession process".
*{{flag|Serbia}} — President Aleksandar Vučić congratulated Siljanovska-Davkova, saying that he was "confident that we will together continue to work on strengthening Serbia-Macedonia ties".
*{{flag|Ukraine}} — President Volodymyr Zelenskyy congratulated Siljanovska-Davkova and expressed optimism in cooperating with North Macedonia to ensure peace and stability in Europe.
*{{flag|United States}} — Ambassador Angela Aggeler expressed her "heartfelt congratulations" to Siljanovska-Davkova on her "historic election as the first female President." She also extended her congratulations "to all those citizens who exercised their right to vote in the presidential and parliamentary elections."
